decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Territorial Kavu, and Scion of Draco. This deck also utilizes Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact to control the board and protect its creatures. Lightning Bolt provides additional removal and reach, while Nulldrifter and Consign to Memory offer card advantage and flexibility. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, with cards like Wooded Foothills, Arid Mesa, and Flooded Strand to ensure the right colors are available when needed.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to play aggressively and quickly, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Dragon's Rage Channeler, Slickshot Show-Off, and Cori-Steel Cutter to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The deck also includes a number of instant spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart for direct damage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and burn spells, while also taking advantage of card advantage and card selection with cards like Expressive Iteration and Preordain.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while also using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge to control the board. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment provide additional reach and damage potential. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the goal is to quickly pressure the opponent and close out the game before they have time to stabilize.

The deck focuses on assembling UrzaTron lands to generate massive amounts of mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and colorless spells. It uses Karn, the Great Creator to tutor for specific artifacts to disrupt the opponent's strategy and control the board. The deck also includes Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void to slow down the opponent's spells, while Sowing Mycospawn provides additional mana acceleration. Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Thought-Knot Seer help control the battlefield, while Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger provide a strong win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to quickly deal damage to the opponent by using efficient creatures like Territorial Kavu and Scion of Draco, while also having access to powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck also focuses on generating card advantage and controlling the board with cards like Leyline of the Guildpact and Consign to Memory. By maintaining pressure on the opponent and controlling the board, this deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on using creatures with cycling abilities to quickly fill the graveyard, then casting Living End to bring them back onto the battlefield at once. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Endurance to protect the combo. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells and removal until it can unleash a massive board presence with Living End, overwhelming the opponent and securing victory. The key is to efficiently cycle through the deck, control the game state, and time the Living End for maximum impact.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly casting low-cost creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. It includes cards that provide card advantage and allow for quick card selection, along with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck also includes pump spells like Mutagenic Growth to increase the damage output of its creatures. By utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can set up their own game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers like Ugin, Karn, and Emrakul. By assembling UrzaTron lands and ramping up mana quickly with artifacts like Mind Stone and Sol Talisman, the deck can cast expensive spells early on. The inclusion of Thought-Knot Seer disrupts the opponent's strategy by forcing them to reveal their hand and potentially removing a key card. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with high-powered threats and disruptive control elements.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes a mix of burn spells, card draw, and pump effects to keep up the pressure. The deck aims to control the board and deal damage efficiently, with a focus on tempo and utilizing the UR color combination for versatility and efficient mana usage. It also includes tools for disrupting the opponent's strategy and maintaining card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then using spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to cheat them into play. Using countermagic like Force of Negation and disruption like Thoughtseize, the deck aims to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The combination of instant reanimation and powerful creatures with abilities creates a fast-paced and unpredictable playstyle that can catch opponents off guard.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy a wide array of artifacts onto the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful artifacts. By utilizing cards such as Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, the deck can generate a large amount of mana early on to cast threats like Memnite and Salvage Titan. Cards like Urza's Saga and Thoughtcast help to further fuel the deck's artifact synergies, while cards like Metallic Rebuke and Engineered Explosives provide additional ways to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck aims to be fast, efficient, and versatile in order to outpace the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly build a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with early aggression. The main strategy involves playing powerful artifacts like Mox Opal, Memnite, and Engineered Explosives to generate mana and control the battlefield. Additionally, cards like Metallic Rebuke and Urza's Saga are used to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain pressure. The deck aims to win quickly by deploying threats and using efficient spells to control the game.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving creatures like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker, supported by cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes ways to search for key pieces using cards like Ancient Stirrings and Urza's Saga. The goal is to overwhelm and outvalue the opponent through a synergistic combination of creatures, spells, and artifacts, ultimately leading to a game-winning play with Emrakul, the Promised End or other finishers like Walking Ballista.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of efficient removal spells and disruptive creatures. It seeks to pressure the opponent's life total quickly while also controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to apply pressure and close out the game. With a mix of removal, disruption, and threats, this deck looks to systematically dismantle the opponent's strategy while keeping up the pressure to secure a swift victory.

The deck revolves around utilizing cards like Ruby Medallion, Pyretic Ritual, and Desperate Ritual to generate massive amounts of mana quickly and cast multiple spells in a single turn. This enables the player to storm off and chain together a large number of spells, ultimately winning the game with a massive Grapeshot or other burn spell. The deck also includes cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Wrenn's Resolve to help filter through the deck and find the necessary combo pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells before they can mount a defense.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Broodscale Bloodchief's ability to sacrifice creatures in order to gain power and create a powerful combo. By combining cards like Vexing Bauble, Kozilek's Command, and Blade of the Bloodchief, the deck can quickly build up its creatures and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Devourer of Destiny provides additional threats and options for the player. The deck also benefits from using lands like Grove of the Burnwillows and Eldrazi Temple to generate mana and accelerate its strategy.
